title: 105_s170
content: The "Clone Pager Authorization Act of 1996" amends definitions in the Wire and Electronic Communications Act to include communication made through a clone pager. It also prohibits the use of pen registers, trap and trace devices, or clone pagers without authorization. Additionally, it amends Chapter 206 of the Act. Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code is amended to include clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices. The amendments also update the language in the chapter analysis and section 3121 to reflect the inclusion of clone pagers. The amendment includes clone pagers in addition to trap and trace devices in Chapter 206 of title 18, United States Code. Section 3122 is updated to authorize the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager upon court approval. The amendment allows the use of a pen register, trap and trace device, or clone pager with court approval for ongoing criminal investigations. It includes details such as identifying the subscriber of the clone pager and the number of the paging device. The amendment allows the use of a clone pager in ongoing criminal investigations with court approval. It includes details such as identifying the subscriber of the clone pager and the number of the paging device. The amendment permits the use of a clone pager in criminal investigations with court authorization. It specifies the information required for the clone pager, including subscriber identification and device number. The amendment allows the use of a clone pager in criminal investigations with court approval. It outlines the necessary information for the clone pager, such as subscriber identification and device number. The amendment permits the use of clone pagers in criminal investigations with court authorization, defining a clone pager as a device that intercepts communications meant for another paging device. The Senate passed the amendment on November 7, 1997. Attest: GARY SISCO, Secretary.
